concise_definition: adj. 提议的, 建议的; v. 提议, 建议 (propose 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: Describing something that has been put forward for consideration, approval, or acceptance, but has not yet been finalized or implemented.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某事物已被提出以供考虑、批准或接受，但尚未最终确定或实施。
definitions.example_en: The proposed budget for next year includes significant cuts to education funding.
definitions.example_cn: 明年的提议预算包括对教育资金的重大削减。

definitions.explanation_en: Referring to a plan, idea, or suggestion that is currently under review or discussion before being adopted.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一个正在被审查或讨论、尚未被采纳的计划、想法或建议。
definitions.example_en: She presented a proposed design for the new city park.
definitions.example_cn: 她提出了一个新城市公园的设计方案。

definitions.explanation_en: To put forward a suggestion, plan, or course of action for consideration by others.
definitions.explanation_cn: 向他人提出建议、计划或行动方案以供审议。
definitions.example_en: He proposed a new strategy to increase customer retention.
definitions.example_cn: 他提出了一项新策略以提高客户留存率。

definitions.explanation_en: To make an offer of marriage to someone.
definitions.example_en: He proposed to her under the stars last weekend.
definitions.example_cn: 上周末，他在星空下向她求婚了。

comparison.analysis: “Suggested” (建议的) 语气较温和，常用于非正式或试探性场合，强调提供一个可选意见；而 “proposed” 更正式、更具主动性，常用于正式场合中提出一个具体、可执行的方案，带有更强的意图推动决策。
“Recommended” (推荐的) 暗示基于专业判断或经验而给出的正面意见，通常带有权威性；而 “proposed” 不一定包含评价，仅表示‘提出’，可能是中性的、尚未被验证的方案。
“Planned” (计划好的) 指已经经过周密安排、即将执行的事项，具有确定性；而 “proposed” 仍处于提议阶段，尚未获得批准或实施，不确定性更高。
